name: All in the Numbers! Quiz | Sports Mixed | 25 Questions

questions.text: The number one can sometimes be a lonely number, unless you are the number one at the top.  Which cricket batsman was the first-ever to score 50 Test centuries, and reached this milestone in 2010?
questions.explanation:
Sachin Tendulkar.

	Tendulkar achieved this milestone in the first Test in December 2010 against South Africa.  The Indian batsman also surpassed 14,500 runs.  He broke the record of Brian Lara for the most runs scored in Test cricket in October 2008.  Sachin was also the first batsman to score 12,000, 13,000 and 14,000 runs in a career.

questions.text: The number 2 is dedicated to which country, who in 1999 won their second Rugby Union World Cup?
questions.explanation:
Australia.

	The Rugby Union World Cup began in 1987 with New Zealand topping runner-up France.  Australia won their first World Cup in 1991 over England, then in 1999 took their second cup against France, 35-12.

questions.text: The number 3 was immortalized in the baseball world by this player who wore the number 3 on his back, and who hit 714 career home runs.  Who is this Hall of Fame great?
questions.explanation:
Babe Ruth.

	Ruth played for three teams during his baseball career from 1914-1935.  He was a pitcher in his early days, then moved to the outfield so his team could profit from his bat strength, most notably with the New York Yankees.  Nicknamed "The Sultan of Swat", he hit 50 home runs in a season four times in his career.

questions.text: The number 4 is dedicated to this tremendous Indianapolis 500 race car driver, who won the race four times in his career.  Who is this driver?
questions.explanation:
Al Unser.

	Al is one part of a long line of Unser drivers in the sport.  Al won the 500 in 1970, 1971, 1978, and 1987.  Others to win the big race four times were A.J. Foyt and Rick Mears.

questions.text: The number 5 is in honor of this Major League Baseball team, who won five consecutive World Series crowns in the 1940s and 1950s.  Which team was this?
questions.explanation:
New York Yankees.

	The Yankees, under the management of Casey Stengel, won five World Series from 1949-1953.  They also won four consecutive from 1936-1939.  In the 20th century, the Yankees made 36 World Series appearances.

questions.text: The number 6 is dedicated to those Original Six National Hockey League teams that launched ice hockey into today's world.  Those teams were the Boston Bruins, Chicago Blackhawks, Montreal Canadiens, New York Rangers, Toronto Maple Leafs, and which other team?
questions.explanation:
Detroit Red Wings.

	The 'Original Six' were there for 25 seasons until the 1967 NHL Expansion took over and added more teams to the league.  The Montreal Canadiens was the first team to win 10 Stanley Cups.

questions.text: The number 7 is in honor of the second National Football League team to make seven Super Bowl appearances.  Which team was this?
questions.explanation:
Pittsburgh Steelers.

	The Steelers made their first appearance and won their first Super Bowl in 1975 in Super Bowl IX.  There were many more to follow, including a Super Bowl X win over the Cowboys, Super Bowl XIII over the Cowboys, and XIV over the Rams.  Their fifth appearance resulted in a loss to the Cowboys in Super Bowl XXX in 1996.  The Steelers' sixth appearance and their fifth win came in Super Bowl XL against the Seahawks, then the magic number 7 appearance created their sixth win against the Cardinals in February 2009.  Washington Redkins were the first to play in seven Super Bowsl. They were there in 1971, 1972, 1976, 1978, 1979, 1993, 1994, and 1996.

questions.text: The number 8 is dedicated to this American NBA Basketball team which won an amazing eight consecutive NBA Championship titles.  Which team was this?
questions.explanation:
Boston Celtics.

	The Celtics were a true dynasty in basketball in the early days.  From 1959-1966, they pulled off eight consecutive NBA Championships.  They were led the by the great Bob Cousy and Bill Russell.  Five of those eight wins were on the hands of the Lakers, another powerful NBA franchise.

questions.text: In 1999, the number 9 flowed well, and saw this English soccer team win its ninth FA Cup.  Which powerhouse was this?
questions.explanation:
Manchester United.

	Manchester United claimed their first FA Cup in 1948 with a 4-2 win over Blackpool.  Many more were to follow, but would have to wait until 1963 to bag their second one against Leicester City.  They later dominated with cup wins in 1977, 1983, 1985, 1990, 1994, 1996, then their ninth cup in 1999 against Newcastle United.  They later won number 10 in 2004 against Millwall 3-0.

questions.text: The number 10 is in honor of this left-handed professional bowler, who won 10 professional major titles in his career.  Who was this crew-cut wearing bowler who died in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Earl Anthony.

	Earl's trademark was the crew-cut hair style.  He won his first of an amazing 43 PBA (Professional Bowlers Association) titles in 1970.  Earl won six PBA National Championships, two Firestone Tournament of Champions titles, and two ABC (American Bowling Congress) Masters titles.

questions.text: The number 11 is dedicated to this American National Basketball Association coach who was the first to win 11 NBA Championships.  Who is this coach?
questions.explanation:
Phil Jackson.

	Jackson began his NBA endeavors as a player in the 1970s with the New York Knicks.  In 1989, Phil took over the Chicago Bulls and Michael Jordan as their coach.  All total, Jackson coached the Chicago Bulls and Los Angeles Lakers, and his 11th coaching ring came in 2009, as the Lakers defeated the Boston Celtics in the NBA Finals.  He surpassed Boston's legendary coach Red Auerbach for most coaching crowns.  He also passed the Celtics Bill Russell for most titles as a player and a coach combined.  Jackson also won two rings as a player with the Knicks.

questions.text: The number 12 refers to which professional tennis great who won her 12th Grand Slam tennis title in 2010?
questions.explanation:
Serena Williams.

	The four Grand Slam tournaments are the Australian Open, the French Open, Wimbledon, and the US Open.  Serena was the defending champion, and won her fifth Australian Open and 12th Grand Slam after defeating Justine Henin 6-4, 3-6, 6-2, in 2010.

questions.text: The number 13 is superstitious to some, but not this National Football League quarterback who wore the number 13 throughout his entire football career with the Miami Dolphins.  He was the first quarterback in history to throw for 5000 yards in a season, and also the first to throw more than 40 touchdowns in a season.  Who is this Hall of Fame quarterback?
questions.explanation:
Dan Marino.

	Marino played his entire 17-season career from 1983-1999 with the Dolphins.  In '13' of his seasons, he passed for over 3000 yards.  Although he set many records in his NFL career, Dan was never able to take his team to a Super Bowl appearance.

questions.text: The number 14 is dedicated to this professional tennis player who tied a record with his 14th major singles title at the 2009 French Open.  Which tennis player won his 14th grand slam title in 2009?
questions.explanation:
Roger Federer.

	Federer tied the record held by Pete Sampras, who won 14 major singles from 1990 to 2002.

questions.text: The number 15 is in honor of the 15th championship that this NHRA racing driver won in 2010.  Who is this drag racing great?
questions.explanation:
John Force.

	Force, never at a loss for words, won his 15th title combined between dragsters and funny cars in 2010.  It was very improbable that he would return after a terrible 2006 crash, which he suffered what appeared to be career-ending injuries in Texas during a competition.  The 61-year old won his first title in 2010 since that crash, making it an unprecedented 15 NHRA crowns.

questions.text: The number 16 is most noted for this National Football League San Francisco 49er quarterback, who took his team to four Super Bowl appearances.  He won two season MVP awards to go along with two Super Bowl MVP awards.  Which NFL Hall of Fame great wore this number 16?
questions.explanation:
Joe Montana.

	Montana played with the 49ers from 1979-1992.  His final two seasons were with the Kansas City Chiefs while wearing the number 19.  His most famous hook-up was with wide receiver Jerry Rice, who they both set numerous passing and receiving records with.

questions.text: The number 17 is dedicated to the first American National Basketball Association team to win 17 NBA Championships.  Which basketball team was this in 2008?
questions.explanation:
Boston Celtics.

	The Celtics won their first-ever NBA Championship in 1957 against the St. Louis Hawks.  Crowns to follow were from 1959-1966, 1968, 1969, 1974, 1976, 1981, 1984, and 1986.  Their 17th title came in the 2007-08 season, when they won the finals against the Los Angeles Lakers, four games to two.

questions.text: This number 18 was seen on the door of this 2010 NASCAR driver.  After a promising 2009 season, he did not fare well in 2010.  Who was this Joe Gibbs racing team driver?
questions.explanation:
Kyle Busch.

	Love him or hate him, Kyle is not there for any reason except to win races.  After beginning his NASCAR career at 16 years old in the NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series, Busch graduated to the Nationwide Series, then the Sprint Cup Series for the big boys.  Kyle turned aggressive as a driver, and has received a lot of payback also.  His final win of the 2010 season was the Bristol Motor Speedway.  Kyle won three races in 2010 and finished in eighth place of 85 drivers for the season.

questions.text: The number 19 is dedicated to this National Hockey League 2010 Chicago Blackhawk captain.  He was the third overall pick in the 2006 NHL draft.  Who is this?
questions.explanation:
Jonathan Toews.

	Toews' first season with the Blackhawks was in 2007-08, and was a Rookie of the Year Award nominee.  In 2008-09, he became captain of the Chicago team at only 20 years of age.  He was a Stanley Cup winner in 2010.

questions.text: The number 20 is in honor of T20 cricket.  Who was the first cricketer to score a century in a T20 international match?
questions.explanation:
Chris Gayle.

	The first-ever world Twenty20 match was held in 2007.  Gayle scored the first international T20 century with 117 not out against South Africa.

questions.text: The number 21 is dedicated to this Major League Baseball player who was killed in a plane crash during a humanitarian mission, to fly relief supplies to Nicaragua in 1972.  Who was this Hall of Fame Pittsburgh Pirate that wore the number 21?
questions.explanation:
Roberto Clemente.

	Clemente played his entire career with the Pirates from 1955 until his death on December 31, 1972.  In his previous season just a few months earlier, Roberto collected his final hit, number 3000 just before the season ended.

questions.text: The number 22 is a historical number, as in 1922.  This was the first season of America's National Football League.  Which team won the first-ever NFL Championship?
questions.explanation:
Canton Bulldogs.

	After the AFPA League folded in 1921, the National Football League was ready to go with 18 teams that participated throughout the 1922 season.  The Bulldogs won the first NFL Championship with a 10-0-2 record with the Chicago Bears finishing second, and the Chicago Cardinals in third.  In 1923, Canton repeated as NFL Champions with a record of 11-0-1.  The franchise folded after the 1926 season.

questions.text: The number 23 was worn by a Hall of Fame American NBA Basketball player.  Who was he that played for the Chicago Bulls, and also had a famous sports shoe named after him?
questions.explanation:
Michael Jordan.

	Michael "Air" Jordan played for the Bulls under coach Phil Jackson from 1984-1998.  Michael set many NBA records and helped the Bulls to six NBA Championships.

questions.text: The number 24 is dedicated to this NASCAR racing driver who had the number 24 on the side of his car.  Being well known for his association with DuPont as a sponsor, who is this?
questions.explanation:
Jeff Gordon.

	Gordon came up from racing sprint cars into the big time with NASCAR.  In 2010, he was racing for the Hendrick Motorsports team, and closed out the season with his 82 career win.  That moved him into sixth place all-time, and one race win behind the great Cale Yarborough.

questions.text: The number 25 is in honor of a baseball player who originally wore the number 24.  When he signed with his second team, the number 24 was retired, so he took the number 25.  He went on to break Hank Aaron's career home run record.  Who was this San Francisco Giant?
questions.explanation:
Barry Bonds.

	Bonds began his career as a Pittsburgh Pirate in 1986.  He won the National League MVP Award in 1990 and 1992 with Pittsburgh, then as a Giant, he won more in 1993, and from 2001-2004.  Bonds broke Hank Aaron's home run record of 755, and retired with 762.   Barry left baseball in 2007 under a shroud of controversy over illegal substance usage.
